info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Henderson and southwestern Polk Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Hendersonville, or near Etowah, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Mills River, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Bat Cave, Valley Hill and Horse Shoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
